thread.title: Watch a cheeky cheetah get face-to-face with a tourist on safari
thread.title_full: Watch a cheeky cheetah get face-to-face with a tourist on safari

title: Watch a cheeky cheetah get face-to-face with a tourist on safari
text:
The cheetah just wasn't scared of getting up close and personal David Horsey 
At one point it even looked like the big cat was going to curl up on Mr McCaldin's lap. 
But with its razor sharp claws and teeth, this is one moggy you certainly don't want making itself comfortable. 
Family friend David Horsey, who captured the tense standoff between the pair, said: "I've been living in Kenya all my life and I've never seen anything like this. CATERS The bold cheetah jumped in the jeep to join the safari group CATERS The cheetah just wasn't scared of getting up close and personal 
"The cheetah just wasn't scared of getting up close and personal. 
"At first Mickey was really relaxed but I think he was quite concerned it might try and sit in his lap. 
"Unlike a domestic cat, you certainly don't want that." CATERS The tourists remained considerably calm during their close encounter 
Mr McCaldin was on holiday in Kenya with his wife and sister to visit his friend Mr Horsey and his wife Vicky. 
The bizarre event happened last week as the group tracked a well-known family of cheetahs, whose mother is called Malaika. 
Having followed the cheetahs for a couple of days during their stay, the safari group had noticed the family hadn't had a kill for a few days. CATERS The rest of the cheetahs jumped on top of the jeep to look for prey 
Mr Horsey, who has lived in Kenya all his life, said: "The family had been looking for a gazelle for a few days with no luck. 
"As we'd been around for a couple of days, I think they were used to the jeep so the mum jumped on top to get a better view. 
"I think the other cheetah tried to follow her up but went a different way." CATERS The cheeky cheetah certainly made itself at home 
Once the cheetah seemed to grow bored of its close human encounter, it turned away and looked out the vehicle for a few minutes before jumping out. 
Mr Horsey said: "You never know what you're going to come across - just like this." CATERS The hungry cheetahs hadn't caught any prey in days Related articles
